message.content: {"id": "12906", "title": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if it is already opened (should display error message)", "description": "When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor does nothing. This should instead display a warning message in the workbench, informing the user that opening the file in another editor may cause changes to be overwritten, and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message can be displayed, indicating that all files need to be closed first. This is believed to be a safety feature in WSAD that prevents external editing while a file is already opened in WSAD.", "OB": "Open the Java Perspective and double click on a java file to open it in the workbench. Right click on the same file and select 'Open With .. System Editor'. Currently, nothing happens, but a warning message or error message should be displayed as described in the description.", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12906', 'title': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)', 'description': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg) ', 'OB': "Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
